title: Core Member Services Rep Interview
Interview Descriptions:
Normal. Didnt ask about my background just spoke about the position and what the conpany
 offered. 
The experience was similiar to most other companies but this company are only looking for bodies.
Interview Questions:
Basic Questions nothing difficult.
Horrible onboarding process.
Tr

title: Customer Sercive Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UHC in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had an online interview that is set up in Microsoft teams Camera were on so you were not talking to a blank screen very welcoming enviornment spoke benefits and allowed PTO
Interview Questions: What can I bring to the team What do I do if I come across difficult patients Would I rather work as a team or by myself

title: Claims Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UHC in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was very professional and helpful.  Lasted approximately 30 minutes.  My wifi failed at one point but was able to reconnect and continue with my interview.  Some questions were difficult to answer but she helped me understand and find the answer.
Interview Questions: Describe your current job and your job duties.

title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UHC in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Long very long. Hard detailed questions. Really have had to work in a Call Center before and have taken simulation tests. There was an assessment. A video interview and then a real interview.
Interview Questions: What would you say or how would you react to a stakeholder in the company and how can you improve an experience with them.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UHC (Manchester, NH) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews three or more with a spaced out time period. Took a few weeks just to get through the interviews They have extensive background check, require multiple references and have a very long application process. Prolonged follow up period.
Interview Questions: Nothing unique, just experience and what I would bring to the company

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UHC
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were situational interviews where you have to name a situation and relate it the core value that the interview contact provides. It can be very lengthy and time multiple people may participate
Interview Questions: Name time where you had to help out with a task that was not with your daily task.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UHC
Interview Descriptions: It was an on campus interview. Mostly questions from your resume. The only coding question was sort an array and remove duplicates. They were happy I was able to do it with mergesort. Couple of behavioral questions including why UHC, tell me about yourself etc. They do want you to ask questions. Overall a very easy interview.

title: Adjuctor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UHC (Doral, FL) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: not bad they call back within a few day 3 interview process background check kind of long the job offer higher not that much higher if u have the job education
Interview Questions: how can you benefit the company

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UHC (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: very intimidating, it was a panel of five individuals. They asked a lot of questions to see if you could do the job. Had to come back a second time to interview with another director
Interview Questions: How do you handle working for multiple directors

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UHC in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Takes weeks for any action, then; the rush is on for clearance & drug testing.  A template of questions is used to maintain consistency during the interview process. Pretty standard and easy if you are skilled in the requirements needed in the position you are applying for.  A training program is required for most new hires & the Trainers do a great job of relaying the skills you will need to be successful.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you witnessed something unethical, what was the situation & how did you handle it?
